ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Awareness and training

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Refresher Training of ASHA SATHIs and Orientation of the Sector Supervisors on IPC Skill Building using Mobile Kunji, which is an audio-visual job aid designed for to build the capacity building to change at the grass-root level and responsible for influencing behaviours through inter-personal communication (IPC). The mobile phone-sized cards are illustrated with key messages on Maternal Health, Child Health, Immunization, Malaria, Diarrhea, Personal Hygiene and Sanitation..

The project Rural Initiatives for governance and Human Rights (RIGHR) is continuing 3rd year of 3rd phase .The third phase started from 1st july 2011. LKBK achieved to organize different programmes successfully .Capacity building to key staff, village leaders, community leaders ,staffs, cooperative.Livelihood promotion: training on sustainable agriculture

LKBK construct the IHHLs for those beneficiaries in Sarasara Gram Panchayats of Harabhanga Block of Boudh District under Swachh Bharat Mission (Gramin) for IEC and hardware activities. And serve as a way for accessing the larger underserved stakeholders in the nascent sanitation market to work together to solve the issues. Apart, the LKBK is dealing with the materials required for the construction of not only sanitary latrines but also other sanitary facilities required for individuals, families

LKBK organized 7 batches of Field Training of ASHAs on Module 6&7 (Round-4) at LKBK conference Hall, Sarsara, Boudh with the support of National Health Mission (NHM), Boudh. Total 210 nos of ASHAs including 102 nos of ASHAs from Harbhanga Block and 108 nos of ASHAs from Boudh Block participated in the training programme. During the training ASHAs developed their knowledge and skill on management of breast feeding problems ,Child Health and nutrition ,Maternal Health and New born care.
Folk Show on "Mass awareness on Health and Nutrition as per the 1000 days approach"at Bandhapathar,Bamanda,Mathura
LKBK successfully constructed 138 IHHL (G) at Khaunali,Mahulpali,Sidhapur,Sarasara from Sarasara Gram Panchayat,Harabhanga Block of Boudh District with the support of District Water

LKBK organized 7 batches of Refresher Training of ASHAs on HBNC at LKBK conference Hall, Sarsara, Boudh with the support of National Health Mission (NHM), Boudh. Total 210 nos of ASHAs including 102 nos of ASHAs from Harbhanga Block and 108 nos of ASHAs from Boudh Block participated in the training programme. During the training ASHAs developed their knowledge and skill on Introduction and overview on RMNCH A approach, Role and responsibility of ASHA in maternal health etc.
Field Training to Newly of HBNC Round (1,2

A Block Level Consumer Awareness Programme was organised at Anshula Panthika Resort,Charichhak,Harabhanga Block,Boudh.In this programme Sri Prafulla Kumar Behera,A.E.E.,Harabhanga Block as Chief Guest,Mrs. Rajalaxmi Patra, Sarpanch,Banibhusanpur Gram Panchayat

LKBK with the support of Vedanta Foundation successfully completed Tailoring training to 160 students from Harabhanga block of Boudh district through its project .200 students of Harbhanga Block from Boudh District successfully completed their Computer Training.The objective of the vocational training centre is to enable individuals nationwide to achieve greater success by providing required basic computer knowledge
Capacity Building Capacity building to CRP CMs, WSHG Book Keepers on WSHG Book Keeping .Federation Function
102 nos of ASHAs including 68 nos of ASHAs from Harbhanga Block and 34nos of ASHAs from Boudh Block participated in module 6

NIOS accredited to LKBK as District Training Site to conduct the Refresher Training of ASHAs on Certification Course, to educate and prepare ASHAs to appear for the examination on certification course. Total 234 ASHAs were enrolled from Boudh district to appear the Theory examination after the internal and external evaluation by the Internal and External Evaluator

In order to promote demand generation for Routine Immunization in Odisha, Unicef has supported the State Health & Family Welfare Dept. by rolling out capacity building initiatives called as Taranga- Social Behavior Change Communication Training for demand generation on Routine Immunization. The emphasis is being laid on improving communication among front line workers (ASHAs & ASHA Sathis)

Home-Based Newborn Care Plus (HBNC ) is an innovative packaging and delivery of preventive and promotive evidence-based interventions for optimal infant care practices at home. This is implemented through community link workers (accredited social health activist (ASHA)), by home visitation at regular intervals. A total numbers of 298 ASHA/ANMs were trained under HBNC . Successful implementation in Boudh district through achieving coverage to scale up of HBNC in all low birthweight babies.

In this context a training of ASHAs on Population Based Screening on Common NCDsi aims to reduce the premature mortality from cardiovascular diseases, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory diseases by 2025. The main focus of this action plan is on the four major NCDs, “Cardiovascular Disease, Cancer, Chronic Respiratory Disease and Diabetes”, but also highlight the four shared behavioural risk factors, “Tobacco Use, Unhealthy Diet, Physical Inactivity and Harmful use of Alcohol”.

The Hunger Project-India,New Delhi started the activity aimed to aware about the status of Women in the Society,their own roles and responsibility,vision building and the need of working together in Boudh district along with Elected Women Representatives (EWRs).Assessing the ability of elected women representatives to question and defy entrenched social norms, transform gender relations, demand accountability and ensure inclusive development within their constituencies.

ngoList.title: LOKSEBAK
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: LOKSEBAK has been running a Special School of Mentally Retarded & Cerebral Palsy at the District Headquarter Bhawanipatna of Kalahandi District since April 2006. Presently this institution consists of 52 nos. of children with Mentally Challenged. Trough different teaching and learning materials the special education and training are given to the differentially able children. The voluntary organization LOKSEBAK has involved in the different agricultural activities like Hybrid maize cultivation under RKVY, Maize is one of the most important cereal crops with diverse utility. it has been consider as one of the important cash crops in odisha, maize primarily grown in Kharif. Popularisation of Hybrid maize programme has been taken up in Kharif 2013 in Kesinga Block of Kalahandi district covering 1675 Ha. In PPP mode under RKVY with support of ATMA, Kalahandi. The Programme has been successfully implemented. The Organization is also involve improveing sugarcane cultivation under Sustainable sugarcane initiative with Dept. of Agriculture, Kalahandi in Bhawanipatna, Kesinga, Th. Rampur, Narla, M.rampur, Lajigarh & Golamunda Blocks and covered 100 Ac. successfully. The Systems of Rice Intensification (SRI) is a methodology aimed at increasing the yield of Rice produced in farming. It is a low water, Labour intensive, organic method that use younger seedlings singly spaced and typically hand weeded with special tools. During the year Rabi 2013-14 LOKSEBAK cultivated 50 Ha. of paddy cultivation by SRI method including 66 nos. of farmers in Kesinga Block with support of Agriculture Dept. of Kalahandi.

During this year organised 3 nos professional Assessment camps conducted for deaf children by Audiologist from Berhampur. Total 57 deaf children tested their hearing level, this is a new for the parents, before that they do not know what is Audiometric test. In this camp parents knew the process of hearing assessment and aware on percentage level hearing and other problem of their children. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: M-Zone Dance Studio has been founded by Mandakini Jena in 25th May, 2011 with Pravata Kumar Rana being the trustee. With learned trainers in various dance forms it teaches various creative dance forms by retaining the Indian ethinicity to spread social awareness among different age groups. It also organizes Summer camps in dance. It provides free dance lessons to orphans in the Ashram and transgenders so that they could maintain their self-dignity in the society and showcase their talents.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Activities included:- ï¶ Community Education ï¶ Health Education and Awareness Camps. ï¶ Distribution of Medicines for Common Diseases. ï¶ Kitchen Gardening. ï¶ Community Sanitation. ï¶ Women Organisation. During the Last year i,e reporting year, we have continued our approached to sustain the programmes. ï¶ The Mahila Mandals are able to continue their saving programme regularly. ï¶ Regular meetings are being held to interact with each other to drive out the problems. ï¶ They are availing the health facilities provided by the Govt. institutions. ï¶ Like-wise most of our members are raising kitchen gardens in their backward the house. ï¶ Some how they are become aware about the cause and effect of common diseases. Child Labour Programme:- â€œNISRURTâ€ is working for the depressed oppressed children in the society. In order to aware about the cause of the child labour our organization hand arranged 12 nos. of Awareness camps in the near by villages to eradicate the child labour in the district. Women Development: One uniqueness of our programme is that so far on women participation in some specific action were initiated for women development. The Philosophical rational behind such move is uplifting their status by pulling them into being organized, to make them conscious about their unique role in reshaping the society. To create confidence among themselves, to tackle their own problems in particular and the society in general and to arrange financial support for grant to being self reliance. In this way the resulting figure is that in almost all the programmes villages a women organization i,e â€œMAHILAMANDALâ€ is present. The leaders of the groups have been given training and exposure on related issues. Now they do show keen interest on regular immunization of their children, environment cleanness plantation, small saving and income generation programmes. There collective involvement involvement in community development activities is measurable one. Consumer Awareness Programme: Rallies, Padayatras, and Symposia have become a regular features of â€œNISRURTâ€ we had covered all most all villages of our project area under Gondia Block of Dhenkanal district through meetings and seminars. In the year 2014-15 the organization conducted Awareness Programme by organizing meetings and seminars to under take Socio-cultural education.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Biodiversity conservation & Community development in Satkosia Tiger Reserve (STR) The objective of the project is to create awareness and provide Capacity Building of the Eco-Development Committees (EDC) to strengthen their institutions at community level to ensure the inclusive sustainable development. This was implemented in 18 villages to provide alternative sustainable livelihoods thorough EDCs. Campaign on Polythene free in Satkosia Tiger Reserve with Livelihoods support to the Eco-Tourism Groups (ETGs) & Self Help Groups (SHGs) The broad objective of the project is to bring to an end the polythene use by tourists and local people inside the tiger reserve. It is based on the concept to sensitize the Tourists & Picnickers to avoid the use of polythene and carry out the alternatives. So, the basic activities are to train the village stakeholdersâ€™ ecotourism groups who are managing picnic spots/nature camps on management and safety disposal of polythene. They will completely avoid the use of polythene materials. By this effort, the use of polythene has reduced to maximum level and now the women SHG members are gainfully employed. Study on biodiversity of Mandaragiri â€“Kallima hill proposed biodiversity heritage site The basic objective of the program was to have an in-depth study on the bio-diversity existence of the Mandargiri-Kalima Hill to establish the need of the declaration of bio-diversity heritage and bring to the eye side of the people. A series of studies was made and the existence of the different species was included under the process of study. Socio-Economic Study of Local People & Awareness Campaign in Satkosia Tiger Reserve The objective of the project was to collect data on the socio-economic life and livelihood of the people in Satakosia area and create awareness to enhance their participation in management of reserve. The data collected from the villages along with the awareness and finally documentation was made by the way of detail analysis. Implementation of Odisha Forestry Sector Development Project (OFSDP) This is one of the unique projects supported by the Govt. of Odisha with assistance of International Consultancy Agency, JICA, Japan. The basic objectives of the project are to restoration of forest, ensuring sustainable livelihood with capacity building of the forest fringe villagers. The main purpose is also to involve the community in forest protection, management and development of the community. The project has been implemented in 206 [Vana Sanrakhyan Samiti[VSS] in Angul Forest Division and 18 Eco Development Committee[EDC] in Satkosia (WL) Division of Angul and Cuttack Districts. Organizational initiative on environmental education in Schools: By the self initiative of the organization, a special drive has been taken in school level to sensitize the students towards environment, bio-diversity, wildlife and upkeep their interest for nature. Organization has adopted 80 schools in all blocks of Angul District by the way of awareness camp, different competition programs, exposure and plantation in the school campus. This program has been highly recognized by the school management and the inspiration of the students and teachers is enlarging.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Natures Club started working with environment and wild life in Bhitakanika wild life sanctuary in inaccessible parts of Kendrapara District in 1994 and soon found out that children in the periphery villages and rural pockets are in very difficult situation in 1995. Natures Club coordinated the first pulse polio immunization programe in Kendrapara district.Our partnership with UNICEF started from there and continued till 2003. In which we worked in prevention of malnutrition and child rights and child protection and Meena initiative and Meena club concept. A unique social change tool was invented by Natures Club. A documentary film on our Meena activites was developed by UNICEF national office named some where over the rainbow one of our project participant Jyotirmayee Mahapatra was awarded by international youth foundation as young social entrepreneur for her roll as Meena. Natures Club also acted as the district NGO coordinating agency of the child environment project support.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Netaji Memorial Club has its office at Garadpur is giving service on social sector since last ten years. The administrative office of the organisation is related with all the administrative works and has its owned infrastructure at Garadpur of district Kendrapara. The organisation is working in the field of health and family welfare and promoting the Indian system of medicine ,naturopathy and yoga at its operational area. The organisation is working in the field of income generation and promoting various income generation activities like Food Processing, art & craft, IT etc. In the field of small savings and micro credit ,it has taken steps on formation self help groups at its operational area. Also it has taken steps on women and child development activities creation of awareness on field of protection of drugs ,anti AIDS like disease, road safety etc. It has also taken steps on promotion of library activities at the rural and got partial success in the field of promotion of education. The members of the organisation are well qualified, experienced and energetic to accelerate to various activities which has been initiated by the organisation
